articles.title: Man, 60s, arrested on suspicion of murder of Annie McCarrick released without charge
articles.description: This comes as specialist officers continue to search a property in Clondalkin, west Dublin, where the suspect once stayed
articles.content:
A man arrested on suspicion of the murder of Annie McCarrick has been released without charge.
The man, who is aged in his 60s, was arrested on Thursday morning and detained under Section 4 of the Criminal Justice Act 1984.

articles.title: Prosecution to answer Duterte's bid for interim release
articles.description: The prosecution in the crimes against humanity case against former President Rodrigo Duterte will answer before the International Criminal Court his request for interim release to a country, which his lawyer said has agreed to take him in.
articles.content:
"The Office of the Prosecutor of the International Criminal Court will file before the Pre-Trial Chamber I a response to the defense's request for the interim release of Mr. Rodrigo Roa Duterte," the office said in an email to GMA News Online.

articles.title: Proposed NASA radio probe could use gravity 'lumpiness' to reveal the insides of alien worlds
articles.description: A new NASA probe in development known as GIRO represents a low-cost step toward unlocking the secrets of exoplanets, all through the invisible pull of gravity.
articles.content:
Engineers have designed a compact, battery-powered radio probe that could help unlock the secrets of alien planets.
The proposed small probe, known as the Gravity Imaging Radio Observer (GIRO), would use gravity fields to precisely map the interiors ... [5343 chars]

articles.title: Scientists detect light passing through entire human head, opening new doors for brain imaging
articles.description: For decades, scientists have used near-infrared light to study the brain in a noninvasive way. This optical technique, known as fNIRS (functional near-infrared spectroscopy), measures how light is absorbed by blood in the brain, to infer activity.
articles.content:

articles.title: Talbot Green police station attacker jailed for attempted murder
articles.description: Alexander Dighton is sentenced to life with a minimum of 22 years for attacking a police station.
articles.content:
Dighton was already known to counter-terrorism police in Wales, he was interviewed by officers a year before the attack.

articles.description: The nose and front wheel of Air India flight 171 landed on a canteen building where students were having lunch.
articles.content:
